--- title: "Lecture [06b] Activity" --- ![](../../img/programmer_2780E3.svg){.hero} ## Question 1 (Scales) a) Use the `penguins` dataset from the \{palmerpenguins\} package to create a plot that maps `species` to the x-axis and `body_mass_g` to the y-axis. Add a violin geom and a jitter geom (with 0.25 width). For the jitter geom only, map `sex` to color. b) Configure the y axis to range from 2500 to 6500. c) Configure the x-axis to use the scientific names of each species (see table below) d) *Bonus:* Suppress all messages and warnings from this chunk. | Common Name | Scientific Name | |-------------|------------------| | Adelie | *P. adeliae* | | Chinstrap | *P. antarcticus* | | Gentoo | *P. papua* |

Click here for the answer key
::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(palmerpenguins) ggplot(penguins, aes(x = species, y = body_mass_g)) + geom_violin() + geom_jitter(width = 0.25, aes(color = sex)) + scale_y_continuous(limits = c(2500, 6500)) + scale_x_discrete( labels = c( "Adelie" = "P. adeliae", "Chinstrap" = "P. antarcticus", "Gentoo" = "P. papua" ) ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](06b_Activity_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672} ::: :::

## Question 2 (Labels) Modify your final plot from Question 1 in the following ways: a) Give the x-axis, y-axis, and the color scale better labels (with Title Case) b) Give the plot a descriptive title about what the graphic is about (generally) and a subtitle that describes which sex-species combination had the highest body mass. c) Add a caption stating the source of this data (e.g., the package name)

Click here for the answer key
::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(penguins, aes(x = species, y = body_mass_g)) + geom_violin() + geom_jitter(width = 0.25, aes(color = sex)) + scale_y_continuous(limits = c(2500, 6500)) + scale_x_discrete( labels = c( "Adelie" = "P. adeliae", "Chinstrap" = "P. antarcticus", "Gentoo" = "P. papua" ) ) + labs( x = "Penguin Species", y = "Body Mass (g)", color = "Sex", title = "Body Mass by Species and Sex of Penguins at Palmer Station", subtitle = "The penguins with the highest body mass were males of the P. papua species", caption = "Data from the {palmerpenguins} R package" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](06b_Activity_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672} ::: :::

## Question 3 (Themes) Modify your final plot from Question 2 in the following ways: a) Apply the "classic" complete theme using `theme_classic()` and change the base font size to 10. b) Adjust the `legend.background` element to be rectangle with `color = "black"`. c) Adjust the `axis.text.x` element to be text with `face = "italic"`.

Click here for the answer key
::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(penguins, aes(x = species, y = body_mass_g)) + geom_violin() + geom_jitter(width = 0.25, aes(color = sex)) + scale_y_continuous(limits = c(2500, 6500)) + scale_x_discrete( labels = c( "Adelie" = "P. adeliae", "Chinstrap" = "P. antarcticus", "Gentoo" = "P. papua" ) ) + labs( x = "Penguin Species", y = "Body Mass (g)", color = "Sex", title = "Body Mass by Species and Sex of Penguins at Palmer Station", subtitle = "The penguins with the highest body mass were males of the P. papua species", caption = "Data from the {palmerpenguins} R package" ) + theme_classic(base_size = 10) + theme( axis.text.x = element_text(face = "italic"), legend.background = element_rect(color = "black") ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](06b_Activity_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672} ::: :::
